garten2018dictionaries.title: Dictionaries and distributions: Combining expert knowledge and large scale textual data content analysis: Distributed dictionary representation
garten2018dictionaries.author: Garten, Justin and Hoover, Joe and Johnson, Kate M and Boghrati, Reihane and Iskiwitch, Carol and Dehghani, Morteza
garten2018dictionaries.paperMotivationText: Theory-driven text analysis has made extensive use of psychological concept dictionaries, but
garten2018dictionaries.paperContributionText: Introduction of the Distributed Dictionary Representations (DDR), a method that applies psychological dictionaries using seman tic similarity rather than word counts.
garten2018dictionaries.paperResultsText: By generating a distributed concept representation based on the words in a dictionary, DDR provides a continuous measure of similarity between a concept and any other word, phrase, or document. This is shown in three case studies (only the second is relevant regarding morality): Sentiment Analysis, Morality Detection and Dictionary selection.
garten2018dictionaries.dataDomainOtherText: Tweets containing hashtags relevant to Hurricane Sandy
